page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO EYEMOUTH
page.content: {INTRODUCTION TO EYEMOUTH} Eyemouth is situated on the North Sea coast 44 miles east of Edinburgh and 61 miles north of Newcastle-upon-Tyne. The town grew up due to the rare opportunity on this rocky coastline of a natural harbour surrounded by relatively low lying and fertile land. The town grew steadily as a market and a port for the surrounding agricultural area. Fishing has always been the traditional industry of the town with men employed on the boats and women in the fish curing. The unique arrangement of buildings and spaces in the harbour area, Church Street, Market Place and High Street, tightly clustered for shelter and defence is a characteristic of the old town. Narrow two storey building with pitched roofs, slates, pantiles, stone and render are typical.
